trans-unit.source: A skybox light is an ambient light emitted by a skybox. Stride analyzes the skybox texture and generates lighting using image-based lighting (Wikipedia).
trans-unit.target: A skybox light is an ambient light emitted by a skybox. Stride analyzes the skybox texture and generates lighting using image-based lighting (Wikipedia).

trans-unit.source: Skybox lights are good for exterior scenes, where the skybox is visible. They're less useful for interior scenes, such as in rooms where the skybox is only visible through windows; as the skybox light nonetheless lights the entire room, this creates an unnatural effect.
trans-unit.target: Skybox lights are good for exterior scenes, where the skybox is visible. They're less useful for interior scenes, such as in rooms where the skybox is only visible through windows; as the skybox light nonetheless lights the entire room, this creates an unnatural effect.

trans-unit.source: These images show the difference between ambient and skybox lighting on two pure diffuse materials:

trans-unit.target: These images show the effect of skybox lighting on a material with different metal and gloss properties:

trans-unit.source: Notice how the skybox texture colors are reflected.
trans-unit.target: Notice how the skybox texture colors are reflected.

trans-unit.source: To use a skybox as a light, you need to add a skybox asset, then select it in a Light component.
trans-unit.target: To use a skybox as a light, you need to add a skybox asset, then select it in a Light component.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, click Add asset
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, click Add asset

trans-unit.source: The Select an asset window opens.
trans-unit.target: The Select an asset window opens.

trans-unit.source: Choose a skybox texture from the project assets and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Choose a skybox texture from the project assets and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds the skybox asset with the texture you specified.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds the skybox asset with the texture you specified.

trans-unit.source: Select the entity you want to be the skybox light.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity you want to be the skybox light.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), click Add component and select Light.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), click Add component and select Light.

trans-unit.source: In the Light component properties, under Light, select Skybox.
trans-unit.target: In the Light component properties, under Light, select Skybox.

trans-unit.source: Select the skybox asset you want to use as a light source and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the skybox asset you want to use as a light source and click OK.

trans-unit.source: The Light component uses the skybox asset to light the scene.
trans-unit.target: The Light component uses the skybox asset to light the scene.

trans-unit.source: When you use a skybox as a light, Stride uses it both in compressed form (spherical harmonics (Wikipedia)) and as a texture to light different kinds of material. You can control the detail of both in the skybox asset properties.
trans-unit.target: When you use a skybox as a light, Stride uses it both in compressed form (spherical harmonics (Wikipedia)) and as a texture to light different kinds of material. You can control the detail of both in the skybox asset properties.

trans-unit.source: The texture to use as skybox (eg a cubemap or panoramic texture)
trans-unit.target: The texture to use as skybox (eg a cubemap or panoramic texture)

trans-unit.source: Use the skybox only for specular lighting
trans-unit.target: Use the skybox only for specular lighting

trans-unit.source: The level of detail of the compressed skybox, used for diffuse lighting (dull materials). Order5 is more detailed than Order3.
trans-unit.target: The level of detail of the compressed skybox, used for diffuse lighting (dull materials). Order5 is more detailed than Order3.

trans-unit.source: The texture size used for specular lighting. Larger textures have more detail.
trans-unit.target: The texture size used for specular lighting. Larger textures have more detail.

trans-unit.source: Which entity groups are affected by the light. By default, all groups are affected
trans-unit.target: Which entity groups are affected by the light. By default, all groups are affected
